title: First Cricket Match
description: The first recorded cricket match took place in 1646 in Kent, England and the first Test match was played between Australia and England in 1877 at the Melbourne Cricket Ground

title: Oldest Cricket Club
description: The Marylebone Cricket Club (MCC), founded in 1787, is the oldest cricket club in the world.

title: Most World Cup Final appearances
description: Two Australians are the only players who have appeared in four World Cup finals - in 1996, 1999, 2003 and 2007. One is Glenn McGrath and the other one is Ricky Ponting.

title: Sachin Tendulkar's Records
description: Sachin Tendulkar holds the record for the most runs in both Test matches and One-Day Internationals (ODIs).

title: Don Bradman's Batting Average
description: Sir Don Bradman, considered one of the greatest batsmen of all time, had an average of 99.94 in Test cricket.

title: T20 Cricket
description: Twenty20 cricket, a shorter format of the game, was introduced in 2003. It has since become very popular.

title: Cricket World Cup
description: The Cricket World Cup is held every four years. The first tournament took place in 1975 in England.

title: Highest Individual Score
description: Brian Lara holds the record for the highest individual score in a Test innings, with 400 not out against England in 2004.

title: First ODI Hat-Trick
description: The first hat-trick in One-Day Internationals was taken by Jalal-ud-Din of Pakistan against Australia in 1982.

title: First T20 International
description: The first T20 International match was played between Australia and New Zealand in 2005.

title: Most Sixes in an ODI
description: Rohit Sharma of India holds the record for hitting the most sixes in an ODI inning, with 16 sixes against Australia in 2013.

title: First Women's Cricket Match
description: The first recorded women's cricket match took place in 1745 in Surrey, England.

title: First Cricket World Cup Win
description: The West Indies won the first two Cricket World Cups in 1975 and 1979.

title: Longest Cricket Match
description: The longest cricket match was a Test match between England and South Africa in 1939, which lasted 12 days.

title: First Day-Night Test Match
description: The first day-night Test match was played between Australia and New Zealand in 2015 at the Adelaide Oval.

title: First Double Century in ODIs
description: Sachin Tendulkar was the first player to score a double century in an ODI, scoring 200* against South Africa in 2010.

title: Fastest Century in ODIs
description: AB de Villiers holds the record for the fastest century in ODIs, reaching 100 in just 31 balls against the West Indies in 2015.

title: First Tied Test Match
description: The first tied Test match was played between Australia and the West Indies in 1960 at the Brisbane Cricket Ground.

title: Most Wickets in Test Cricket
description: Muttiah Muralitharan of Sri Lanka holds the record for the most wickets in Test cricket, with 800 wickets.

title: Fastest Ball in Cricket
description: Shoaib Akhtar of Pakistan bowled the fastest recorded ball in cricket, clocking at 161.3 km/h (100.23 mph) against England in 2003.

title: First Hat-Trick in Test Cricket
description: The first hat-trick in Test cricket was taken by Fred Spofforth of Australia against England in 1879.

title: Most Centuries in Test Cricket
description: Sachin Tendulkar holds the record for the most centuries in Test cricket, with 51 centuries.

title: First IPL Match
description: The first match of the Indian Premier League (IPL) was played in 2008, with Kolkata Knight Riders defeating Royal Challengers Bangalore.

title: First Pink Ball Test Match
description: The first pink ball Test match was played between Australia and New Zealand in 2015 at the Adelaide Oval.

title: Most Runs in a Calendar Year
description: Mohammad Yousuf of Pakistan scored the most runs in a calendar year in Test cricket, with 1,788 runs in 2006.

title: First Cricket World Cup for Women
description: The first Women's Cricket World Cup was held in 1973, two years before the men's tournament.

title: Youngest Test Cricketer
description: Hasan Raza of Pakistan is the youngest cricketer to play in a Test match, debuting at the age of 14 years and 227 days.

title: Most Sixes in International Cricket
description: Chris Gayle of the West Indies holds the record for the most sixes in international cricket across all formats.

title: First Cricket Commentary
description: The first live cricket commentary was broadcast by the BBC in 1927.

title: First Day-Night ODI
description: The first day-night ODI was played between Australia and India in 1979 at the Sydney Cricket Ground.

title: Most Matches as Captain
description: Ricky Ponting of Australia has captained his country in the most international matches, across all formats.
